Articles.Content: I need to get better time warp,, because right now, my game is just too slow and getting transfer windows takes way too much time. I already have the BetterTimeWarpContinued 2.3.13 mod, but even after putting it in the ksp mods file, it still does not show up. Am I doing something wrong, or did I download the wrong file? pls help

What is the "ksp mods file"?

Do you use CKAN (not required I'm just asking for information)

Have you loaded other mods successfully?

Where EXACTLY did you put the fiile(s)?

And finally, make sure you read this post. Help us help you!

to answer some of the above questions, in my gamedata folder i have a folder called mods. I have kerbal engineer redux and kerbal alarm clock in there and that works fine, but better time warp doesnt. I put the file in the same mods folder as my kerbal engineer redux mod (which works), but the better time warp is still not working.  

Edited January 19, 2023 by Glitchd
added some more detaileed answers
actually never mind superflous j i used ur mod and its working very well thanks a lot man

On 1/19/2023 at 3:31 PM, Glitchd said:

to answer some of the above questions, in my gamedata folder i have a folder called mods. I have kerbal engineer redux and kerbal alarm clock in there and that works fine, but better time warp doesnt. I put the file in the same mods folder as my kerbal engineer redux mod (which works), but the better time warp is still not working.  

This is completely wrong. With very few specific exceptions, all KSP mods should be put directly into GameData either by copying the mod's files and folders into GameData or by copying whatever's inside [mod name]/GameData and pasting that into KSP/GameData. Adding extra folders into the mix will break anything that relies on finding files in specific places and the fact that this hasn't caused problems for you yet is most likely just pure luck.

I strongly recommend you use CKAN to install your mods for you rather than installing them manually.
